Package com.frc5113.library.vision.limelight

Class Limelight

java.lang.Object
com.frc5113.library.vision.limelight.Limelight
public class Limelight extends Object
Utility class to speed up work with the "fruit camera" Limelight.

The Limelight Class was started by Corey Applegate of Team 3244 Granite City Gearheads. We Hope you enjoy the Limelight camera. Further modifications by Spectrum and the Combustible Lemons.

      latency (ms)

    • setStream

      public void setStream(LimelightControlModes.StreamType stream)
      stream Sets limelight’s streaming mode
      • kStandard - Side-by-side streams if a webcam is attached to Limelight
      • kPiPMain - The secondary camera stream is placed in the lower-right corner of the primary camera stream
      • kPiPSecondary - The primary camera stream is placed in the lower-right corner of the secondary camera stream
      Parameters:
      stream - Secondary camera placement

    • getStream

      public LimelightControlModes.StreamType getStream()
      Get the current camera positioning
      Returns:
      Streaming mode

    • setSnapshot

      public void setSnapshot(LimelightControlModes.Snapshot snapshot)
      snapshot Allows taking a camera render up to 2 times per second. Value MUST be set to zero after each snapshot to take another snapshot, see:

      Fix "snapshot" networktables key. Users must set the "snapshot" key to "0" before setting it to "1" to take a screenshot. (Bug fix changelog 2022.2.3 (3.16.22))



      kon - Take 1 snapshot koff - Do not take a snapshot (default com.frc5113.library.state)
      Parameters:
      snapshot - Whether to take a snapshot

    • getSnapshot

      public LimelightControlModes.Snapshot getSnapshot()
      Get whether the limelight has taken a snapshot
      Returns:
      Whether the limelight has taken a snapshot

    • getAdvanced_RotationToTarget

      public double getAdvanced_RotationToTarget(LimelightControlModes.Advanced_Target raw)
      Limelight posts three raw contours to NetworkTables that are not influenced by your grouping mode. That is, they are filtered with your pipeline parameters, but never grouped. X and Y are returned in normalized screen space (-1 to 1) rather than degrees.
      Parameters:
      raw - Target
      Returns:
      Degree of target
